segment.source: How to use Setup Information (.inf) files to create installation packages.
segment.target: How to use Setup Information (.inf) files to create installation packages.

segment.source: Using Setup Information (.inf) files to create packages (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)
segment.target: Using Setup Information (.inf) files to create packages (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)

segment.source: Using Setup Information (.inf) files to create install packages
segment.target: Using Setup Information (.inf) files to create install packages

segment.source: IEAK 11 uses Setup information (.inf) files to provide uninstallation instructions.
segment.target: IEAK 11 uses Setup information (.inf) files to provide uninstallation instructions.

segment.source: Uninstallation instructions let your employees remove components, like files, registry entries, or shortcuts, through the Uninstall or change a program box.
segment.target: Uninstallation instructions let your employees remove components, like files, registry entries, or shortcuts, through the Uninstall or change a program box.

segment.source: For details about .inf files, see INF File Sections and Directives.
segment.target: For details about .inf files, see INF File Sections and Directives.

segment.source: To add uninstallation instructions to the .inf files
segment.target: To add uninstallation instructions to the .inf files

segment.source: Open the Registry Editor (regedit.exe) and add these registry keys:
segment.target: Open the Registry Editor (regedit.exe) and add these registry keys:

segment.source: Where "description" is the name that shows up in the Uninstall or change a program box and "command-line" is the command that runs after the component is picked.
segment.target: Where "description" is the name that shows up in the Uninstall or change a program box and "command-line" is the command that runs after the component is picked.

segment.source: Make sure your script removes the uninstallation registry key, too.
segment.target: Make sure your script removes the uninstallation registry key, too.

segment.source: Otherwise, the component name will continue to show up in the Uninstall or change a program.
segment.target: Otherwise, the component name will continue to show up in the Uninstall or change a program.

segment.source: You can't use RenFiles to move a file to a different location, it only lets you rename a file in its existing location.
segment.target: You can't use RenFiles to move a file to a different location, it only lets you rename a file in its existing location.

segment.source: For detailed information, see INF RenFiles Directive.
segment.target: For detailed information, see INF RenFiles Directive.

segment.source: You can't use CopyFiles to copy a file to another place on your hard drive, it can only copy files from the source disk to the destination directory.
segment.target: You can't use CopyFiles to copy a file to another place on your hard drive, it can only copy files from the source disk to the destination directory.

segment.source: For information, see INF CopyFiles Directive.
segment.target: For information, see INF CopyFiles Directive.
